intro: Pentapetes velutina, commonly known as the velvet pentapetes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ornamental horticulture and ecological studies.
